newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Resources to lift spending.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Resources to lift spending.

text.p: Australian Resources Ltd said on Thursday that it expects to spend about A$15 million on exploration for copper and gold in 1996/1997, mainly in Queensland and Western Australia.
This compares with A$13.5 million in 1995/96, managing director Richard Windsor told Reuters.
Windsor said the focus would be on new finds outside the company's Selywyn copper/gold mine in Queensland and the Gidgee and Mount Mclure gold mines in Western Australia.
"Instead of spending virtually all of our money around the three operating mines we are going into more grassroots or advanced exploration projects outside the mine areas," he said.
Higher depreciation and amortisation charges contributed to six percent decline in the company's 1995/96 net profit to A$15.5 million, reported earlier on Thursday, Windsor said.
Weighted average cash operating cost for gold production increased to A$267 an ounce in 1996/97 compared with A$260.00 an ounce in the previous year, the company said.
For the latest year, the company said it produced 200,764 ounces of gold, up marginally from 198,184 the previous year.
Australian Resources previously has said the Gidgee mine incurred high production costs in the second half, which would weigh on 1995/96 profits.
At 12.45 p.m. (0245 GMT), Australian Resources shares were trading two cents higher at A$0.87.
